reviewText: If you're a Linda Eder fan, you must have this dvd.  It is an incredible concert, and every part of it is first rate, from the band to the choir to the arrangements, and especially Linda herself.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Her favorite part of Christmas is being home with family and friends, so gather your family and friends and sit down with her.  The DVD is better than the CD.  You feel more in the Christmas spirit when you are watching the songs be sung "live".  You also get some non-Christmas songs, like "God Bless America" and "Son of a Preacher Man".  Linda Eder gives a high quality performance and I recommend this DVD.  Merry Christmas!  (If you like her, then you would probably like Christmas music from Martina McBride (special Target version with 16 songs), Suzy Boggus, Jo Dee Messina, and everything from Amy Grant.)
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a discovery! We were not familiar with Linda Eder.  The Amazon reviews were so good we took a chance and bought the DVD.  Linda Eder is heavenly. We will enjoy watching her Christmas Stays The Same concert every year.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This Christmas DVD only comes second to seeing her perform these songs live like when I first saw her in Dr Jekyll and Hyde. Didn't know who she was then but knew right away she was now my best female singer. I agree with the clarity of her tone, the perfection of her pitch, her extraordinary octave range, the emotion in her phrasing makes you feel like your there in her songs. She has so much talent.You will enjoy watching her Christmas DVD every year... but see her live if you can!
summary: Linda Eder brings the house down
Title: N/A

reviewText: I would recommend this video to anyone who likes Linda Eder. She has such a beautiful voice. I look forward to possibly seeing her in concert.
Title: N/A

reviewText: No stone in my heart can ever excel beyond what this art, this voice can do to soften it... and for that need to be softened, I am continually enslaved.Leaving this artist/concert behind is like an elephant trying to leave a memory behind, it simply cannot be done; I am convinced of it. I know, I've tried.If there ever was a moment in American music history it would be the moment this singer turns face to face with the voices in the choir and uses her own supernatural gift to create what appears to be visual weaving as she intuitvely sings "silent night", weaving in and out of each singer with sound as if she were creating her own handmade tapestry.And when you finish the concert... you realize it was your heart she wove.In the end there she is, a singer who's face and voice are like a living painting, Tall Dark Stallion Girl; one that is impossible to turn from. Captivating her bound audience as if she were the pied piper of hamelin as she sings such songs as "If I should lose my way" and "The little drummer boy".Actually, Eder can change the title "hamelin" to "hearts" and it would portray what she does with utmost accuracy.She should be illegal.Even the lady behind the glass at the Louvre` has some competition with this face and voice, for once viewed, one cannot break free of Eder, to do so is to fail miserably, so if you're not up for this surrender, then don't even bother viewing.It's like reaching through a looking glass one cannot ever fully escape from. Instead of Cheshire cats and rabbits running late you are thrown to the depths of your own creativity the way nothing else propels you there as she sings "Ave Maria" and "Vienna". THIS is what her voice does. THIS is the best way to explain her phenomenon. THIS is the beautiful fool you will become.*sigh*Ya, I'm there. And all I can do is just let it be.I find myself putting up my defenses, disliking the vulnerability her vocal talents create in me, trying to find something wrong, ANYTHING, to justify banishing her from my tv screen only to find myself comparing her to every singer I meet, hear, or work with...helpless in the end.She wins.How does someone who's been "ruined" by her talent go back to what they were before it? The answer: you can't.This DVD should be put under the bow of every wrapped gift given this year, but not before stamping "ILLEGAL" on the tag!P.s. there is an interesting misprint on the cover of this first batch making for a sure collectible.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Linda Eder's Christmas album has been a favorite of mine for the past six years, but I never got a chance to see her concert special on DVD until now.  I wish I had picked it up sooner.  The concert is just as good as the album, if not better, as Linda sings many songs from the album, plus some songs from her own repertoire including Vienna, Gold and her mesmerizing performance of Don't Rain on My Parade from Funny Girl. Linda is in top-form, and it's quite an emotional performance -- it was filmed not too long after September 11th, so many of the songs take on a new meaning in this context.  A must-have.
summary: Christmas or not, a fantastic concert
Title: N/A
